intro: Polyosma cestroides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed polyosma, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that appear in spring. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in open forests and heathlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
